title: TTD presents ‘silk vastrams’ to Srikalahasti temple
content: The TTD delegation offered prayers to the presiding deities of Vayulingeswara and Goddess Gnana Prasunambika

title: ‘Safalam 2026’ to be held in city on February 19
content: A documentary on SAF’s activities will be released at the event. Entrepreneurs associated with SAF for the past 15 years will be honoured on the occasion

title: How ordinary people of Tamil Nadu participated in the making of the Constitution
content: A resident of Kattunedungulam village of the Sivaganga district, sent a hand-written note with a demand that members of his community should have freedom of worship and autonomy to manage their own community

title: Madras as seen in 1942
content: The city, as seen in the 1942 film En Manaivi, seems another world. From there to the Chennai of today, we have come a long way

title: Odisha looking to increase its contribution to national GDP from 3% to 5%: Governor
content: Endowed with nearly one third of India’s total iron ore reserves, Odisha contributed over 61% of the country’s total iron ore production in 2024–25 and holds the first position in the production of steel and stainless steel in the country, says Kambhampati

title: Village headman among 27 persons booked after seven persons get injured at Mayana Kollai festival in Vellore
content: The police said that as per norms, temple chariots should not exceed 12 feet in height. However, during the festival, the chariots were reportedly around 60 feet tall, resulting in the collapse

title: Central experts visit Haryana’s Palwal following mysterious deaths and illness
content: Deputy Commissioner Harish Kumar Vashisht stated that during the investigation, it was found that all cases had a common condition of acute liver failure, characterised by a rapid decline in vital parameters and multi-organ failure

title: Opposition slams ruling alliance over welcome to Macron
content: Political parties and citizens on social media also sought action against the hoardings which they said were put up in contravention to the Bombay High Court order against them

title: Nitish’s son Nishant all out in public before getting any role in the party
content: For the first time, in the individual capacity, he has started inspecting the developmental work which has been launched or started by his father Nitish Kumar

title: BJP back to Rath Yatras to boost political prospects in West Bengal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address a gathering at Kolkata’s Brigade Parade Grounds at the culmination of the yatras across the State

title: In allegation of electoral corruption, guilt has to be proved to the hilt, Sibal submits in Supreme Court
content: He was countering an appeal filed by S.S. Duraisamy alleging that there were videos and photos, contained in CDs, allegedly showing corrupt practices committed ahead of the 2011 election of M.K. Stalin, including the distribution of money to lure voters

title: Reddy loses Bagepalli MLA post with false claim of ‘nil’ tax dues when he actually owed over ₹1.3 crore
content: Declaring ‘nil’ tax dues in the assets and liabilities statement filed with his nomination papers - despite owing ₹1.3 crore in property tax arrears since 2018 - cost S.N. Subba Reddy his MLA post

title: All accused in father-son duo murder during Bemetara communal violence acquitted
content: Seventeen men were arrested for murdering an elderly man and his son, cattle grazers from Biranpur village in Chhattisgarh, in 2023

title: Black box of aircraft from Ajit Pawar’s crash sustained damage
content: A Learjet 45 crashed in Baramati, Maharashtra, on January 28, killing Pawar, both the pilots, a cabin crew member and staff of the leader

title: IT Minister apologises for AI summit troubles; Kharge slams ‘mismanagement’
content: Attendees criticise arrangements on Day 1; flag theft of displayed products and lack of basic amenities; Minister says correction action taken

title: Carrier India all set to invest ₹1,000 crore in manufacturing unit in Sri City
content: Carrier India’s Managing Director Sundaresan Narayanan and Sri City’s Managing Director Ravindra Sannareddy formally exchanged copies of the lease deed in the presence of the Tirupati district Collector S. Venkateswar

title: Mission Mausam to make India weather- ready and climate-smart: official
content: Earth Sciences key to growth, disaster resilience and blue economy, says Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary at memorial lecture

title: India’s first private sector helicopter final assembly line inaugurated near Kolar in Karnataka
content: The facility in Vemagal in Kolar district of Karnataka, is India’s first private-sector helicopter Final Assembly Line for the Airbus H125

title: Budget will be planned to integrate climate action in schemes across departments: Stalin
content: At the summit, Mr. Stalin launched the TN-SHORE scheme, under which ₹1.7 crore has been earmarked as revolving funds and micro-credit support for 34 mangrove conservation committees

title: DMK regime has let down government employees, alleges Palaniswami
content: Speaking to presspersons after the Interim Budget speech at the Assembly, he contends that not even one-fourth of the DMK’s electoral promises, made in the run-up to the 2021 Assembly polls, had been fulfilled

title: Dwarka car accident: Accused’s father breaks silence 'says very sorry, regretful, was not in Delhi'
content: A grieving mother is demanding an underage driver be tried as an adult and stricter action against his father after her son's death. The father expressed regret but claimed he wasn't present during the accident. The case echoes a 2016 incident, reigniting debates on parental responsibility for minors driving high-end vehicles.

title: YouTube down: Thousands globally facing issues with streaming videos
content: YouTube is experiencing a widespread global outage, with thousands of users reporting issues loading videos on both the app and website. Problems include video playback failure, login issues, and streaming interruptions. Backend server configuration errors are suspected as the cause, though YouTube has not yet provided an official explanation.

title: Bengaluru bank employee dies after being hit by speeding bike; CCTV footage emerges
content: A 27-year-old bank employee, Yogeshwari, tragically lost her life after being struck by a speeding Bullet motorcycle while crossing a road in Rajajinagar. The accident occurred during her lunch break as she was returning with a food packet. The biker, a student, also sustained severe head injuries and is undergoing treatment.

title: Modi, Macron launch H125 helicopter assembly line
content: India and France are deepening their strategic ties with a new helicopter assembly line in Karnataka and a potential multi-billion dollar Rafale jet deal. Prime Minister Modi highlighted the nations' shared trust and commitment to manufacturing and exporting advanced technology.

title: Two ducks, no worries! Abhishek Sharma 'has his plans sorted'
content: Despite two ducks in the T20 World Cup, India's team management is backing opener Abhishek Sharma's approach, emphasizing his clear plans and mindset. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak stated that the high-risk nature of T20 means players will get out, and the focus remains on his form and clarity, not just the recent lean run.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari, DVP - Technical Research, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommends buying Bharti Airtel, Finolex Industries, and Coal India as the top stock picks for February 18, 2026. The expert shares a detailed outlook on each stock along with target prices:

title: 'He must be looked after and respected': Sourav Ganguly backs appeal for Imran Khan
content: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly has joined 13 other ex-skippers in urging Pakistan to treat Imran Khan with dignity and provide proper medical care amid concerns over his health in prison. The signatories expressed profound concern over Khan's deteriorating vision and limited access to specialists and family, stressing humane treatment for the former leader.

title: Elon Musk replies to ‘internal email’ where he asked Nvidia CEO for early unit of its supercomputer
content: A 2016 email exchange between Elon Musk and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, revealed in a 2026 trial document, shows Musk requesting early units of Nvidia's revolutionary DGX-1 AI supercomputer for OpenAI. Huang confirmed OpenAI would receive one of the first machines, crucial for developing early AI models that led to ChatGPT.

title: 'Raise India-made component' in Rafale deal: Rajnath to France
content: India has urged France to increase the 'Make-in-India' component to 50% for the upcoming 114 Rafale fighter jet deal, including engine manufacturing and overhauling. This comes as both nations renewed their defense cooperation agreement for another decade, also agreeing to manufacture Hammer missiles in India.

title: Why today's match could define Pakistan’s T20 World Cup fate
content: Pakistan faces a do-or-die T20 World Cup clash against Namibia, needing a win to keep Super 8 hopes alive after a disappointing loss to India.  Concerns linger over senior players Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi's form, while selection changes are being considered.  Namibia, though out, seeks momentum, but for Pakistan, it's a simple win-or-go-home scenario.

title: Adani bets big on AI data centres, to invest $100bn
content: Adani Group plans a massive $100 billion investment by 2035 to establish renewable energy-powered, AI-ready data centers across India. This initiative aims to foster a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem, building on existing partnerships and expanding renewable energy capacity to support India's ambition as an AI hub.

title: Google’s ex CEO Eric Schmidt warns America: We are running out of electricity
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns America faces an electricity shortage, needing 92 gigawatts more power for AI growth.  Massive data centers are straining the grid, with projections showing a significant increase in consumption and potential price hikes.  Tech giants are pledging to cover electricity costs amid these growing concerns.

title: 'My journey started with that one': Hardik Pandya reflects on turning point of his career
content: Hardik Pandya reflects on the pivotal 2016 T20 World Cup final over against Bangladesh, crediting it as the career-defining moment that shaped him. He now aims to unlock his full batting potential, admitting he's only used 40% of it, with his girlfriend Mahieka helping him rediscover his passion for the game through intense training sessions.

title: 'I joined work on 15th day of my husband’s death': How a single mom beat the odds to lead a brand
content: After a tragic accident claimed her husband, Meghali Gupta was compelled to take over the family's 230-year-old jewelry business. Despite initial challenges and personal grief, she dedicated herself to learning every aspect of the business. Her commitment and empathy eventually earned her the respect of long-time employees, allowing her to successfully lead the legacy brand.

title: Michael Jordan’s Daytona 500 celebration sparks online debate
content: NBA legend Michael Jordan is facing online debate after a video showed him touching young Beau Reddick during 23XI Racing's Daytona 500 win. While some deem the gesture inappropriate, others believe he was simply helping the child remove ice from his shirt amidst the jubilant celebration. Neither Jordan nor NASCAR has commented on the viral clip.

title: Larry Wheels slaps Deen the Great during livestream clash
content: The “FAFO” trend actions, bringing quick consequences, played out live on camera this week. Boxer Deen the Great, whose real name is Nurideen Shahid Shabazz, was involved in an awkward confrontation during Quinton “Rampage” Jackson’s double-date livestream. What began as a relaxed and friendly stream quickly turned tense after Deen the Great approached powerlifter and influencer Larry Wheels and his wife, Sheyla Wheels.

title: Kayla Nicole opens up on being single as Swift, Kelce stay private
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are pretty private about their wedding plans even as many guests have confirmed that they have already signed NDAs related to the high profile celebration. Amid this, Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole has shared a clip which has raised eyebrows among fans. The clip shows her hilariously explaining the reason behind why she had no date on Valentine's Day.

title: US military strikes three alleged drug-trafficking boats, killing 11 people
content: US forces struck three vessels in the eastern Pacific and Caribbean. Eleven individuals on board were killed. These actions are part of a campaign that began in September. The US military previously justified lethal strikes against suspected drug traffickers. This approach contrasts with earlier law enforcement methods.

title: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda on not joining films despite Bachchan legacy
content: Despite being born into the illustrious Bachchan family, Navya Naveli Nanda says she never felt any pressure to step into the world of acting. In a recent conversation, Navya addressed the long-standing curiosity around whether she was ever expected to carry forward the cinematic legacy of her grandparents, Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan.

title: Salim Khan hospitalised: Fans slam paparazzi
content: Bollywood star Salman Khan showed clear frustration with paparazzi outside Lilavati Hospital after visiting his father, Salim Khan. Videos captured the actor visibly upset by the intrusive media attention. Fans rallied online, criticizing photographers for their lack of respect and demanding privacy for the Khan family, drawing parallels to similar incidents with the Deol family.

title: Gujarat electoral rolls shrink 13% to 4.4 crore voters after 77 lakh deletions
content: Gujarat's voter count has dropped by 13.4% to 4.4 crore after a special revision removed 77 lakh names and added 9.5 lakh new electors. This significant decline follows two rounds of scrutiny, with over 40 lakh voters identified as permanently shifted and 18 lakh deceased.

title: Rhode Island Interscholastic League suspended as transgender shooter kills ex-wife and son
content: Aidan Dorgan, 23, and his mother Rhonda Dorgan, 52, were shot and killed during a Rhode Island Interscholastic League hockey game at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket. Police say the shooter, Robert Dorgan, 56, later took his own life. The league suspended games. Two relatives remain in critical condition as investigators review motive and online posts.

title: Loosening pyjama string is 'attempt to rape': SC sets aside Allahabad HC ruling
content: The Supreme Court has overturned a controversial Allahabad High Court ruling, declaring that groping a woman and untying her pyjama string constitutes an "attempt to rape." The apex court emphasized the need for judicial compassion and empathy in handling sexual offense cases, reviving stringent charges under the Pocso Act. A committee will now develop guidelines to foster sensitivity in judges.

title: Ajit Pawar plane's black boxes damaged in fire: AAIB
content: Black boxes from the crashed Learjet at Baramati airport sustained significant fire damage, the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau reported. While the flight data recorder was successfully downloaded, specialized help is needed for the cockpit voice recorder. This raises questions about the extent of damage, with experts and politicians calling the CVR's condition mysterious and serious, hinting at potential foul play.

title: Haryana STF nabs 2 Pak youths who fled Jammu juvenile home; hunt on for third fugitive
content: Two Pakistani nationals escaped a juvenile home in Jammu and were arrested 400km away in Ambala Cantonment railway station. They had broken out with a local gangster who injured two police officers. The Pakistani duo planned to flee the country via Nepal. The injured policemen are hospitalized. A fresh FIR has been registered against the trio.

title: Watch: Explosion at New York church; five injured
content: An explosion rocked Abundant Life Fellowship Church in Boonville, New York. Five people were injured in the blast. First responders arrived after reports of a gas odor. A firefighter and one civilian are in critical condition. The church suffered catastrophic damage. Investigations are ongoing into the cause of the explosion.

title: Tina Ambani skips ED summons, 2nd in a month
content: Tina Ambani, wife of Anil Ambani, missed her second Enforcement Directorate summons regarding a money laundering probe. Her husband, Anil Ambani, is also under investigation for a Rs 40,000 crore laundering case. The ED is seeking international cooperation to trace alleged illicit funds, having already conducted numerous searches and attached significant assets.

title: Decision on J&K statehood 'soon'? Omar presses Centre after law minister's statement
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah expressed cautious optimism following Union Law Minister Arjun Meghwal's statement on the imminent restoration of statehood.  Abdullah highlighted the prolonged wait since the elected government took office, emphasizing that patience is wearing thin.  He stressed that statehood is a crucial and sensitive matter, with the Supreme Court also urging its prompt return.

title: NGT nod thwarted Gandhis' bid to stall Nicobar plan: BJP
content: The BJP has criticized Sonia and Rahul Gandhi for opposing the Great Nicobar island infrastructure project, accusing them of attempting to derail it. The party highlighted the National Green Tribunal's approval as a victory against their disruptive efforts. The project aims to establish a major transshipment hub, countering reliance on foreign ports and China's expansionist designs.

title: RPF cop kneels on youth's neck, probe ordered as clip goes viral
content: A Railway Protection Force constable is under investigation. He was seen in a video kneeling on a youth's neck at Tiruvottiyur railway station. The youth was reportedly travelling without a ticket and was drunk. The incident drew widespread condemnation online. Officials have ordered an internal inquiry into the constable's actions. Departmental action will follow the inquiry report.

title: Maharashtra ATS busts soccer club front for radicalisation
content: Maharashtra ATS has busted a radicalisation network operating under a soccer club's guise, raiding 21 locations. A Nagpur grocer allegedly used a Yavatmal club to indoctrinate youth into 'jihadi' ideology, with suspects maintaining cross-border terror links. The operation uncovered a well-funded network grooming vulnerable youths through targeted meetings and workshops.

title: From helicopters to Hammer missiles: Key pacts signed between India and France
content: India and France elevated their relationship to a "Special Global Strategic Partnership" during French President Emmanuel Macron's visit to Mumbai. The two nations signed over 20 agreements, expanding cooperation in defense, trade, critical minerals, and innovation, including joint missile production and helicopter assembly.

title: Salim Khan hospitalised in ICU: Salman Khan, Arbaaz Khan, Alvira and Arpita rush to visit
content: Family members of veteran screenwriter Salim Khan were seen arriving at Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai on Tuesday after the 90-year-old was admitted to the ICU. Superstar Salman Khan arrived along with his mother Salma Khan. Producer Arbaaz Khan was seen with his wife Shhura Khan, while daughters Alvira and Arpita also reached the hospital.

title: 'Messy, risky, dangerous': EAM Jaishankar says global order heading for 'twilight zone'
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar said that ​​economics will give way to politics and security "when it comes to making choices and technology in the age of AI will be even more transformative than ever before." The minister also highlighted how the world today has been witnessing "weaponisation of production, finance, leveraging of market shares and tightening of export controls".

title: Army aspirant accuses TTE of rape bid on train in UP
content: A young Army aspirant traveling for her NCC exam has accused a TTE of attempted rape in a First AC coach of the Ahmedabad-Gorakhpur Express. The incident occurred on Sunday. The TTE allegedly offered her a berth after she boarded without a ticket, then threatened her.

title: 'Work for each other's security': Modi writes to B'desh PM Rahman, extends India invite
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Bangladesh's new prime minister Tarique Rahman on his electoral victory and appointment, extending an invitation to visit India. Modi highlighted the deep-rooted friendship and shared aspirations between the two nations, emphasizing mutual prosperity and security. He expressed eagerness to strengthen bilateral relations across various sectors.

title: Student group plans legal action against 36 UK universities after settling with London college
content: Over 6,000 students, including 30 Indians, have settled with UCL over Covid disruptions. This paves the way for legal action against 36 more British universities for around 100,000 students, including 217 Indians, who paid for in-person education but received online classes and restricted campus access. Lawyers seek damages for the diminished value of their degrees.

title: No plan for monkey sterilisation, says J&K govt amid outrage over massive crop damage
content: Jammu and Kashmir government will not sterilize monkeys despite crop destruction and public safety concerns. Instead, it plans to promote monkey-resistant crops, solar fencing, and deterrent devices. Farmers are also urged to stop feeding the animals, as the simian population continues to pose a major challenge.

title: T20 WC Super 8 qualified teams: India, Zimbabwe — check the complete list
content: India has dominated Group A, securing a Super 8 spot. Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe advance from Group B, surprisingly eliminating Australia. England, West Indies, New Zealand, and South Africa also confirmed their places. Pakistan faces a crucial match against Namibia for the final berth, with USA and Netherlands also in contention under specific circumstances.

title: Infosys-Anthropic pact reignites question: Turning AI risk into opportunity for Indian IT?
content: Infosys shares jumped significantly following a strategic partnership with Anthropic, integrating Claude AI models into its Topaz platform. This move aims to address investor concerns about AI's impact on IT services, focusing on sectors like telecom and finance. The collaboration seeks to leverage domain expertise for complex enterprise AI applications, potentially unlocking new service lines and a substantial market opportunity.

title: India T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 fixtures: Full schedule, dates and venues
content: India secured their Super Eight berth in the T20 World Cup with a dominant victory over Pakistan. This marked their third consecutive win, confirming their place in Group 1. India's campaign included convincing wins against the USA and Namibia, showcasing strong batting and bowling performances.

title: 'There is a method': Ex-India coach decodes Ishan Kishan's masterclass vs Pak
content: Ishan Kishan has made a remarkable comeback in the T20 World Cup, scoring consecutive half-centuries and playing a crucial role in India's Super 8s qualification. His match-winning 77 against Pakistan, characterized by fearless yet calculated strokeplay, has been highlighted as a testament to his form and clear role at the top of the order.

title: Supreme Court lists appeals against suspension of Lalu Prasad’s sentence in fodder scam case in April
content: The case revolved around withdrawals of crores of rupees from the State treasury between 1992 and 1995

title: India, France renew defence cooperation for 10 years, call to boost military partnership
content: India has asked France to increase “indigenous content” in the Rafale by up to 50%, and also expand the Rafale’s maintenance, repair and overhaul facility in India

title: Former Assam Congress chief Bhupen Kumar Borah to join BJP on February 22
content: The announcement by Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma ends speculation about which way Borah will go

title: Watch: Minor granted interim bail after Dwarka crash kills 23-year-old biker
content: The mother of 23-year-old Sahil Dhaneshra has taken to social media seeking justice after he died in a crash in Dwarka on February 3, allegedly involving a car driven by a minor.

title: KIIFB misusing public funds for short-term political purposes: Chennithala
content: Senior Congress leader says the assertion of its CEO that advertising expenditure significantly influences KIIFB’s financial ratings is misleading and contrary to established financial principles

title: Tamil Nadu Interim Budget: Thangam Thennarasu avoids populism, flags fiscal strain
content: He also highlights the challenges faced by Tamil Nadu from the Centre, including the denial of major infrastructure projects, the withholding of funds, curtailment of tax revenues without consultation, and the unfair imposition of conditions mandating expenditure

title: Supreme Court flags the risks of using AI for drafting petitions
content: Justice Nagarathna recalls how a lawyer arguing before her Bench had recently cited a non-existent case law titled ‘Mercy vs Mankind’

title: Poll-bound Assam approves 3% quota for ‘tea tribes’ in Class I and II jobs
content: The Cabinet decision before the Budget presentation is significant, as the community accounts for almost 20% of the voters in the State; the construction of a second Sainik School at Langvoku in Karbi Anglong district has also been approved

title: Vigilance unearths corruption, irregularities in implementation of DDU-GKY scheme in Kerala
content: Preliminary investigations pointed to rampant corruption and irregularities by the project implementing agencies, in collusion with officials.

title: Human super-predators not always ‘super-scary’ to wildlife, finds study
content: Animals in areas exposed to lethal humans tend to be more vigilant and spend less time foraging. In contrast, responses to non-lethal humans, such as tourists or researchers are weaker and more variable

title: Indian Army puts up a show with homegrown dual-use AI systems
content: The Army’s approach encompasses indigenous development, operational readiness and dual-use adaptability, and strengthening defence preparedness while helping build disaster resilience

title: Vellappally accuses of IUML being over-ambitious
content: In an article published in Yoganaadam, the mouthpiece of the Yogam, Mr. Natesan warned that the time may not be far when the majority community in Kerala becomes a minority

title: City of Destiny set for grand International Fleet Review on February 18
content: Elaborate security, sanitation and civic arrangements in place as naval delegates from India and abroad throng Visakhapatnam; Beach Road declared Temporary Red Zone ahead of International City Parade

title: Campaign for Rohith Act demands enactment of Bill in upcoming Budget session
content: They also urged the government to release the draft Rohith Vemula Act for public consultation and announce a clear timeline for its introduction and passage in the Legislative Assembly

title: PDP demands all-party meet in J&K over India-U.S. trade deal’s impact on apple sector
content: Safeguards for local growers amid free trade agreements with the U.S., New Zealand and European nations is the need of the hour, MLA Waheed-ur-Rehmaan Parra says in J&K Assembly

title: 100 BUDS institutions to be raised to model status: Minister
content: Health/life insurance scheme will be launched for BUDS staff from this year; a unified training model would be implemented under the umbrella of the Kudumbashree for teachers and ayahs in these institutions

title: Indiramma Housing drive to cover core urban region
content: Beneficiary selection by March-end; the government would simultaneously focus on land acquisition for Indiramma model colonies in slums, completion of unfinished double-bedroom houses, and allocation of completed units, says Minister

title: Ghee adulteration unpardonable, says Mantralayam pontiff
content: In a letter to Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, the seer has called for an impartial inquiry to bring those responsible to book

title: My statements are always within constitutional limits, have no fear: Assam CM on viral video row
content: “Whatever I say, I speak for the good of Assam and the Hindu society. And I will continue to do so. I believe that I never cross constitutional limits,” says Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Silk Board double-decker flyover ramps set for February completion
content: The 5.12-km double-decker flyover, constructed by BMRCL at an estimated cost of ₹449 crore, was envisioned as a transformative project to streamline vehicular movement at one of city’s most notorious traffic bottlenecks

title: State govt. delaying recruitment due to funds crunch, says Shashil Namoshi
content: He says Congress claims of achievement ring hollow in the face of 2.84 lakh vacant posts across 43 departments in the State

title: 30 km insulated cables laid in Konaseema coconut orchards to prevent outages: District Collector
content: 80 km of insulated network planned across coconut growing areas; 4,500 SC and ST families to receive free rooftop solar panels under Prime Minister Surya Ghar scheme by February-end, he says

title: Paper leak cases: High vigil for SSLC and II PUC exams
content: The II PUC annual exam-1 will be held from February 28, while SSLC exam-1 will be held from March 18

title: Museums are resistance against distortion of history, says Pinarayi Vijayan
content: The Chief Minister was speaking after inaugurating an AKG Memorial Museum at Peralassery in Kannur, featuring six galleries showcasing AKG’s struggles, his role in the freedom movement, parliamentary interventions, and mass agitations

title: President Murmu arrives in Visakhapatnam to participate in International Fleet Review on February 18
content: She was accorded a warm reception by Governor Abdul Nazeer, Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan, and officials on her arrival at INS Dega

title: Two Iranians held with over 200 kg suspected chemical substance off Gujarat
content: The bust was made after the Coast Guard intercepted a speedboat; police suspect new modus operandi to be in play

title: ₹150 crore sanctioned for replacing Dowleswaram Barrage gates, says A.P. Minister
content: The government is taking up 190 minor irrigation works in Kandukur constituency at an estimated cost of ₹10.86 crore, Ramanaidu informs Assembly

title: Kollam collectorate attached by court
content: Directive follows the State government’s failure to deposit compensation for land acquired over two decades ago, despite a direct mandate from  High Court

title: Sources: MLBPA's Clark resigns amid scandals
content: MLBPA executive director Tony Clark resigned Tuesday after an internal investigation revealed an inappropriate relationship with his sister-in-law, who was hired by the union in 2023, sources told ESPN.

title: Vini Jr. accuses 'coward' Prestianni of racist abuse
content: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accused Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni of racially abusing him during the teams' Champions League playoff first leg on Tuesday.

title: Agent: WR Evans plans to continue playing in '26
content: Wide receiver Mike Evans, the Buccaneers' all-time leading scorer, will play a 13th season in 2026 with the destination to be determined, his agent, Deryk Gilmore, told ESPN.

title: QB Rashada's suit vs. Napier, UF booster settled
content: A settlement was reached in the lawsuit filed by journeyman quarterback Jaden Rashada against former Florida football coach Billy Napier and a school booster over a failed NIL deal.

title: Sources: Patriots promote Kuhr to full-time DC
content: The New England Patriots are hiring inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr as their defensive coordinator, sources tell ESPN NFL insider Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: WNBPA counters, with some concessions
content: The WNBA players' union submitted a counterproposal to the league on Tuesday that included some concessions on revenue share and housing, sources told ESPN.

title: Cuban: NBA should 'embrace tanking' for fans
content: Mark Cuban, the former majority owner of the Dallas Mavericks, says the fan experience is chief among the reasons the NBA should "embrace tanking," and that affordability is key in the formula.

title: Moe, legendary former Nuggets coach, dies at 87
content: Doug Moe, who engineered one of the best offenses of its era as coach for the Denver Nuggets in the 1980s, died at 87.

title: Men's Bracketology: UConn retains its No. 1 seed -- for now
content: The Huskies remain on the top line with Houston's loss, but could they be better off as a 2-seed in the East?

title: Women's Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically NCAA tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: The Bilas Index: Ranking the top 68 teams in men's college basketball
content: With a month until Selection Sunday, Bilas reveals which teams he has at the top of the pecking order.

title: Ideal fits for the NFL's 50 best free agents: New teams for Alec Pierce, Malik Willis, Riq Woolen
content: Which team makes the most sense for Pierce? Where do Willis and the QBs fit best? And where could defensive standouts excel?

title: Shiffrin aims for Olympic gold in slalom -- and this time, she's the favorite
content: Mikaela Shiffrin was not expected to medal in Sunday's giant slalom. On Wednesday, she's the front-runner to win gold in slalom.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Alysa Liu skates season best, Forehand makes American history and more
content: Tuesday at the Winter Olympics was headlined by Alysa Liu, Amber Glenn and Isabeau Levito in the women's figure skating short program.

title: Why the Lakers' quiet trade deadline could make for an explosive offseason
content: With LeBron James' uncertain future, draft assets and significant cap space this summer, the Lakers are set up to be a major offseason player -- and maybe even try to land Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: USA vs. Canada is the women's hockey rematch everyone was waiting for
content: How did both teams get here? Who are the players to watch? We break down some of the storylines as the two powers in women's hockey are set to go head-to-head for gold.

title: The improbable comeback of Alysa Liu
content: After retiring from figure skating at 16, Alysa Liu returned on her own terms, with her own quirky style. And she's an Olympic gold medal favorite.

title: Champions League recap: Vinicius leads Madrid to win vs. Benfica, PSG with comeback
content: Enjoy all that happened from today's knockout phase playoff first legs, including Benfica vs. Real Madrid and AS Monaco vs. Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Fooled once but not twice, Real Madrid learned the right lessons for Benfica rematch
content: Three weeks after Benfica's shocking win over Madrid, Álvaro Arbeloa's team returned to Lisbon and proved lightning couldn't strike twice.

title: NBA Finals odds: Thunder, Nuggets still big favorites, Cavs volatile after Harden trade
content: The Cavs' title odds improved with the trade for James Harden, but the Thunder and Nuggets are clear favorites.

title: Paul, Shields, more react to Ronda Rousey vs. Gina Carano
content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano have returned to MMA, and the two will fight on Netflix in May. Here are the top reactions from social media.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer-beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: Ronaldo's next opponents have never lost a domestic match. Wait, what?
content: Which team has won every domestic match in its history? Which champions aren't based in the same country as their league? Here are football's unheralded powerhouses.

title: Meet Noahkai Banks, 19, the outside pick to make USMNT's World Cup squad
content: Noahkai Banks' strong form for Augsburg in the Bundesliga might not just get him in Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT squad for the World Cup -- he might even be a starter.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye shock move for Liverpool's Mac Allister
content: Manchester United are considering a shock move for Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: "Not Charity, But A Right": Court On Maintenance For Estranged Wife
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has affirmed that awarding maintenance to an estranged wife is not charity but a right, whose enforcement is essential to uphold equity, justice and good conscience.

title: "Global Order Changing, Now Headed To Long Twilight Zone": S Jaishankar
content: India is engaging with international partners more intensively and from a "position of strength", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Tuesday, citing a string of recent trade agreements as evidence of the country's growing economic clout.

title: Kerala Biker, 27, Dies After Falling Into Roadside Pit, Probe Ordered
content: A 27-year-old man died after allegedly falling into an open roadside pit near Thodupuzha in Idukki district, police said on Tuesday.

title: Mentally Challenged Man, 45, Beaten To Death In Jharkhand: Cops
content: A mentally challenged man was beaten to death, while six women from Uttar Pradesh were assaulted by mobs over child lifting suspicions in two separate incidents in Jharkhand's Chatra and Bokaro districts, police said on Tuesday.

title: "Unrepentant Bigot": Democrats Slam US Lawmaker Over Anti-Muslim Remarks
content: Rights advocates and multiple Democrats on Tuesday condemned anti-Muslim comments by Republican US Representative Randy Fine who said on Sunday that "the choice between dogs and Muslims is not a difficult one."

title: Iran Temporarily Closes Strait Of Hormuz Amid US Nuclear Talks
content: Iran announced the temporary closure of the Strait of Hormuz on Tuesday for live fire drills in a rare show of force as its negotiators held another round of indirect talks with the United States over the Islamic Republic's disputed nuclear program.

title: Zelensky Says Trump Exerting Undue Pressure On Him Over Peace Deal
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said US President Donald Trump was exerting undue pressure on him in trying to secure a resolution to the nearly four-year-old war pitting Kyiv against Moscow.

title: Iran Has Not Agreed To All Trump's "Red Lines": JD Vance After Geneva Talks
content: Iran has not agreed to all the "red lines" set out by US President Donald Trump for a diplomatic solution, Vice President JD Vance said Tuesday after talks in Geneva.

title: India, France Express Concern Over Ukraine War; Back 2-State Gaza Solution
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday expressed concern over the Russia-Ukraine war, agreeing to support lasting peace through dialogue and diplomacy.

title: UK Deputy PM David Lammy Arrives In Delhi For AI Impact Summit
content: United Kingdom Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy arrived in New Delhi on Tuesday to attend the AI Impact Summit 2026.

title: 18-Year-Old Man Arrested After Running Toward US Capitol With Shotgun: Cops
content: An 18-year-old man ran toward the US Capitol with a loaded shotgun on Tuesday before police arrested him without incident, said US Capitol Police Chief Michael Sullivan.

title: Peru President Impeached After 4 Months In Office Amid Corruption Charges
content: Peru's Congress on Tuesday impeached interim president Jose Jeri, the Latin American country's seventh head of state in 10 years and only the latest toppled over graft claims.

title: French President Macron Invites PM Modi To 52nd G7 Summit In France
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the 52nd G7 Summit, which will be presided over by France in 2026.

title: Punjab Congress Seeks to Bury Factionalism With Unity Outreach For 2027
content: The Punjab Congress appears to be moving towards a phase of greater cohesion and coordination under the organisational oversight of its state in-charge Bhupesh Baghel.

title: 5 People Injured In New York Church Explosion
content: A fiery explosion ripped through a church in upstate New York on Tuesday, injuring five people including a firefighter who was badly burned while responded to reports of a gas odor in the building, officials said.

title: Tarique Rahman's Oath-Taking Ceremony Highlights: Tarique Rahman Takes Oath As Bangladesh's New Prime Minister
content: Tarique Rahman's oath ceremony in Bangladesh: BNP has bagged 209 out of 297 seats, while right-wing Jamaat-e-Islami secured 68 seats in the 13th parliamentary elections.

title: Comic Kunal Kamra Appears Before Committee For Remarks Against E Shinde
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra on Tuesday appeared before the Maharashtra legislative council's privileges committee regarding his alleged remarks against Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

title: "India Has Talent, Entrepreneurial Energy To Become AI Powerhouse": PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that India has the talent and entrepreneurial energy to become an AI powerhouse and the country's startups and tech ecosystem can build AI solutions that enhance manufacturing and generate new jobs.

title: Final Voter List Released In Gujarat; Political Parties Clash Over SIR
content: The political parties in Gujarat reacted strongly following the release of the state's final voter list, with the BJP defending the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and the Congress raising concerns over transparency and procedural issues.

title: AI knows how caste works in India. Here’s why that’s a worry
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. title: All 20 uniform sets for the 2026 World Baseball Classic, from Japan to Team USA
content: The World Baseball Classic is back this spring -- and so are new uniforms. Twenty teams from across the globe will vie for the title this March, with the game's biggest stars set to represent their respective nations.  Shohei Ohtani  will trade the  Los Angeles Dodgers ' customary blue for the colors of Japan, while  Aaron Judge  will swap the  New York Yankees ' iconic pinstripes for Team USA's red, white and blue. Each nation will have a white home jersey as well as an away jersey of a solid base color. Here's a complete roundup of each squad's look for the tournament.
